# Manhattan Associates (MANH) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Manhattan Associates, Inc. is a publicly traded company (Nasdaq: MANH) that has remained debt-free since its founding in 1990 and has over 4,500 associates worldwide. The company is founded in 1990 and is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, serving as a technology company providing supply chain management and omnichannel commerce solutions. Manhattan Associates develops, sells, deploys, services, and maintains software solutions to manage supply chains, inventory, and omni-channel operations.

With over 30 years' experience in supply chain tech, the company unites information across the enterprise, converging front-end sales with back-end supply chain execution. It serves retail, consumer goods, food and grocery, logistics service providers, industrial and wholesale, high technology and electronics, life sciences, and government industries, operating in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Asia Pacific. The company serves more than 1,200 customers worldwide. Manhattan is a 17-time Leader in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for WMS, recognized for its cloud-native, microservices-based warehouse management solutions.

## 2. Existing Products/Services

Manhattan offers warehouse management solution for managing goods and information across the distribution centers; Manhattan Active Warehouse Management, a cloud native and version less application; and transportation management solution for helping shippers navigate their way through the demands and meet customer service expectations at the lowest possible freight costs; Manhattan SCALE, a portfolio of logistics execution solution; and Manhattan Active Omni, which offers order management, store inventory and fulfillment, call center, POS, and customer engagement tools for enterprises and stores.

The company also provides inventory optimization and allocation solutions; technology platform including Manhattan Active Platform solutions, a cloud-native product designed to provide version-less product access. In addition, it provides training and change management services; and resells computer hardware, radio frequency terminal networks, radio frequency identification chip readers, bar code printers and scanners, and other peripherals.

Key existing solutions include:
• **Manhattan Active Platform** - Cloud-native, microservices-based technology foundation
• **Manhattan Active Warehouse Management** - Industry-leading WMS solution
• **Manhattan Active Transportation Management** - Cloud-native TMS solution
• **Manhattan Active Omni** - Order management and omnichannel fulfillment
• **Manhattan SCALE** - Portfolio of logistics execution solutions
• **Point-of-Sale Solutions** - Store retail and customer engagement tools

## 3. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Agentic AI assistants and Agent Foundry will be generally available starting Fall 2025. Kicking off Momentum 2025, Manhattan Associates announced sweeping Agentic AI support within Manhattan Active® solutions that includes intelligent, autonomous digital agents to revolutionize supply chain commerce execution, optimization, and user experiences. These out-of-the-box AI agents, powered by large language models (LLMs) and Manhattan's cloud-native, all-microservice API architecture, will autonomously perform tasks, adapt to changing conditions, and dynamically orchestrate workflows. This breakthrough marks a generational leap from traditional chatbots and static workflow configurations to dynamic, intelligent, and situationally aware orchestration across the entire supply chain and commerce lifecycle.

To further empower customers and partners to innovate at their own pace, the company also launched Manhattan Agent Foundry™, a groundbreaking platform designed to enable organizations to rapidly build and deploy their own agents within the Manhattan ecosystem. Customers can now create specialized agents tailored to their unique processes and preferences, drastically reducing time-to-value, increasing automation scalability, enhancing productivity, and delivering tangible business value.

Among the first groundbreaking AI agents announced are the Intelligent Store Manager, Labor Optimizer Agent, Wave Inventory Research Agent, Contextual Data Assistant, and Virtual Configuration Consultant. Manhattan announced the commercial availability of its AI Agents. This new generation of intelligent, enterprise-ready agents are directly embedded in all Manhattan Active® solutions. Unlike overlay solutions that sit on top of legacy data lakes, these agents live within the Manhattan Active® Platform, enabling them to take real-time action with full operational context.

## 4. Growth Strategy

Manhattan Associates is actively developing and plans to roll out next-generation GenAI capabilities in the first half of 2025. In summary, our preliminary 2025 parameters include: total revenue, excluding license and maintenance attrition, to increase 14%; cloud revenue to increase 23%; services revenue to increase 8%; and RPO to increase 21%; and for an operating margin of 33.5% while increasing our investment in Manhattan leading innovation.

As we enter 2025 with just a little over 80% of our on-premise customers yet to begin their migration to our cloud solutions. A key driver in our strong solutions pipeline is Manhattan's commitment to innovation. And in 2024, we invested about $138 million in research and development.

Key growth drivers include:
• Converting on-premises customers to cloud solutions (over 80% conversion opportunity remaining)
• Acquiring new customers (35% of pipeline represents new logos)
• Cross-selling and upselling to existing customers
• Expanding AI capabilities and agent-based automation
• Geographic expansion, particularly in APAC markets
• Product innovation with significant R&D investment ($138 million in 2024)

## 5. Current and Potential Major Clients

Their customers include many Fortune 500 companies and industry leaders like Home Depot, Nike, DHL, Whirlpool, 3M, and Caterpillar. Some notable companies using Manhattan Associates supply chain solutions include Walmart, Macy's, Albertsons, Neiman Marcus, Tesco, Skechers, Levi's, Toyota, Virgin Atlantic, American Eagle Outfitters, and Williams-Sonoma. Organizations such as CVS Health, Costco Wholesale, Cardinal Health, General Motors and The Home Depot are recorded users of Manhattan WMS for Warehouse Management. Companies using Manhattan WMS for Warehouse Management include: CVS Health, Costco Wholesale, Cardinal Health, General Motors, The Home Depot and many others.

Recent client implementations include:
• **Staples** - Manhattan Active® Warehouse Management—deploying 10 sites in five-week intervals without order disruption
• **Pacsun** - Manhattan Active® Point of Sale across its store footprint after a five-month pilot and an eight-week roll out to 300+ stores, reported record holiday revenue with 40% of online orders fulfilled via stores, logistics expenses down 25%
• **Eaton** - An intelligent power management company, is an early access customer using several of our Active Agents within Warehouse Management. Through the use of the base Wave Coordinator and Labor Agents, Eaton is more nimbly deploying their associates to the right zone to complete fulfillment activities.

## 6. Financial Data & Performance

### Latest Financial Results (Q4 2025)
Manhattan Associates reported revenue of $270.4 million for the fourth quarter ended December 31, 2025, compared to $255.8 million in Q4 2024. GAAP diluted earnings per share for Q4 2025 was $0.86 compared to $0.77 in Q4 2024. Non-GAAP adjusted diluted earnings per share for Q4 2025 was $1.21 compared to $1.17 in Q4 2024.

Consolidated total revenue for the twelve months ended December 31, 2025, was $1,081.4 million, compared to $1,042.4 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2024. Cash flow from operations was $389.5 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2025, compared to $295.0 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2024.

### Key Financial Metrics
The firm has a market capitalization of $10.23 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 48.36 and a beta of 1.02. Manhattan Associates has a 1-year low of $140.81 and a 1-year high of $299.27. The current price of MANH is 168.56 USD — it has increased by 1.87% in the past 24 hours.

In 2024, Manhattan Associates's revenue was $1.04 billion, an increase of 12.23% compared to the previous year's $928.73 million. Earnings were $218.36 million, an increase of 23.67%.

## 7. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Tailwinds
• **Strong Cloud Adoption**: Cloud Revenue: Exhibited significant strength, growing by 33% YoY to $86 million
• **AI Innovation Leadership**: The new embedded AI Agents, Agent Foundry, and fulfillment simulation engine strengthen the story that Manhattan is a "systems-of-record" platform adding practical automation rather than experimental AI
• **Market Leadership Position**: Manhattan is a 17-time Leader in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for WMS
• **Strong Win Rates**: Win Rates: Remain strong at approximately 70%
• **Record Pipeline**: Pipeline: The global solution pipeline is at record levels

### Headwinds
• **Macro Economic Uncertainty**: While the global macro environment presents ongoing challenges, Manhattan Associates remains optimistic about its business fundamentals. We note the turbulent global macro environment could impact our performance
• **High Valuation Expectations**: Recent price target cuts alongside a still-rich earnings multiple underline that execution on these AI capabilities matters, especially after a year of slower earnings and revenue growth versus the wider software sector
• **Integration Complexity**: If customers are slow to adopt or pay for these new AI layers, the risk/reward can shift quickly

## 8. Market Shares

The warehouse management system market is comparatively competitive, with the top 5 participants, namely, Manhattan Associates (US), Blue Yonder Group, Inc. (US), Körber AG (Germany), Oracle (US), and SAP SE (Germany), accounting for a 25-30% share of the market. Manhattan Associates WMS has market share of 1.33% in warehouse-management-system market. Manhattan Associates has market share of 1.08% in supply-chain-management market.

Manhattan Associates, SAP, Oracle, and Blue Yonder anchor the top tier with full-suite offerings and large partner ecosystems. Manhattan crossed USD 1 billion revenue in 2025, and record RPO bookings show sustained pipeline strength.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

The top alternatives for Manhattan Associates WMS warehouse-management-system tool are SAP Logistics Execution with 55.31%, Oracle Warehouse Management with 18.01%, SAP Extended Warehouse Management with 16.13% market share. The companies evaluated and ranked are: Market Leaders: Oracle NetSuite, Blue Yonder, Ehrhardt Partner Group (EPG), Manhattan Associates. All leaders – NetSuite, Blue Yonder, EPG and Manhattan Associates have notable strengths when it comes to preventive maintenance features, operations monitoring capabilities and partnership network.

**Key Differentiators vs. Competitors:**
• Manhattan is the only vendor in the Leader Quadrant to offer a 100% microservice cloud-native WMS
• Manhattan Active Transportation Management (TM) is once again the ONLY cloud-native solution in the leader quadrant
• **AI Innovation**: First to market with embedded Agentic AI agents and Agent Foundry platform
• **Cloud-Native Architecture**: Built from ground up on microservices vs. traditional monolithic competitors

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

Partnering with Google: The company benefits from ongoing advancements in underlying technology from its partner, Google. All agents built in Manhattan Agent Foundry are compatible with emerging industry standards, including A2A and MCP protocols, ensuring seamless interoperability with third-party agent platforms such as Google Agentspace. This reinforces Manhattan's desire to make Agentic AI a key enabler of an interconnected, AI-driven enterprise ecosystem.

Recent strategic appointments include the appointment of Greg Betz as Chief Operating Officer. Betz previously led Microsoft FastTrack, a team of more than 1,000 engineers in 35 countries, focused on cloud conversions for large customers.

FEMA has authorized its Manhattan Warehouse Management System (WMS) for FedRAMP. This extends Manhattan's existing FedRAMP credentials and positions the company as the only supply chain commerce provider with FedRAMP authorization.

## 11. Recent Developments

### AI Innovation Launch (January 2026)
Manhattan announced the commercial availability of its AI Agents. As part of Manhattan Active Agents, customers also gain access to Manhattan Agent Foundry™. This is a groundbreaking platform that enables customers to easily build new agents using simple natural language or quickly customize an existing agent.

### Q4 2025 Earnings (January 27, 2026)
Manhattan's business momentum continues to strengthen. We delivered record fourth quarter cloud bookings, and our industry leading solutions are gaining market share. Manhattan enters 2026 with an expanded go-to-market footprint and numerous opportunities to drive growth from new and existing customers.

### Key Customer Wins
• **Pacsun POS Implementation**: Successfully deployed Manhattan Active® Point of Sale across 300+ stores on November 13, 2025. The cloud-native POS enabled mobile checkout, RFID-powered unified inventory, and omnichannel fulfillment. Pacsun reported record holiday revenue with 40% of online orders fulfilled via stores, logistics expenses down 25%.

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Investment Rating: 8.2/10

**Strengths Supporting High Rating:**
• **Market Leadership**: 17-time Gartner Leader with unique 100% cloud-native architecture
• **AI Innovation Pioneer**: First-to-market with embedded Agentic AI and Agent Foundry platform
• **Strong Financial Performance**: Record revenue growth, strong margins, and robust cash generation
• **Large Conversion Opportunity**: 80%+ on-premises customers yet to migrate to cloud
• **Strong Client Base**: Fortune 500 customers with high switching costs and long contract terms

**Risk Factors:**
• **High Valuation**: P/E of 48.36 requires continued strong execution
• **Macro Sensitivity**: Economic uncertainty could impact enterprise spending
• **Competitive Pressure**: SAP, Oracle maintain larger market share positions

### Fair Value Assessment: $235-250

Based on current fundamentals and growth trajectory:
• **Revenue Growth**: 12-15% annually driven by cloud conversions and AI adoption
• **Margin Expansion**: Cloud transition driving operating leverage
• **P/E Multiple**: 40-45x justified by growth profile and market position
• **2026 EPS Guidance**: $5.04-$5.20 per Manhattan Associates has set its FY 2026 guidance at 5.040-5.200 EPS

**Recommendation**: STRONG BUY for growth investors with moderate risk tolerance. The combination of market-leading position, AI innovation, and significant cloud conversion runway provides compelling upside despite current valuation. The stock offers excellent exposure to secular trends in supply chain digitization and AI automation.
tldr_summary:
Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ: MANH) is a supply chain management and omnichannel commerce software provider serving 1,200+ Fortune 500 customers globally.

The company dominates warehouse management with a 17-time Gartner Leader position and unique 100% cloud-native architecture. It holds significant conversion upside with 80%+ on-premises customers yet to migrate to cloud solutions. Manhattan recently launched embedded Agentic AI agents and Agent Foundry platform, positioning it as first-to-market in intelligent supply chain automation. The company generated $1.08B revenue in 2025 (12% YoY growth) with strong operating margins, and maintains a record solution pipeline. Key risks include premium 48x P/E valuation requiring execution, macro economic sensitivity, and intense competition from Oracle and SAP.

**Rating: STRONG BUY at $235-250 fair value**—market leadership, AI innovation pioneer status, and substantial cloud conversion runway justify premium multiples despite near-term valuation risk.
